qas.question: Which methods are required by CIPA DC-004?
In what year did the three EI techniques from ISO 12232:1998 largely stop being used?
With what cameras can earlier techniques not be used?

answers.text: cameras that produce images only in JPEG format

qas.question: What nation's cameras does the CIPA DC-004 apply to?
How many techniques are widely used in new camera models?
When was the CIPA DC-004 standard released?
Which manufacturers are exempt from CIPA DC-004?

plausible_answers.text: the three EI techniques carried over from ISO 12232:1998

qas.question: After 2007, newer camera models started using what techniques again?
The three EI techniques have to be used on cameras that only capture in what format?

context: The CIPA DC-004 standard requires that <a3_0><b7_0>Japanese<b7_0/><a3_0/> manufacturers of digital still cameras use either the <a0_0>REI or SOS techniques<a0_0/>, and DC-008 updates <a4_0>the Exif specification<a4_0/> to differentiate between these values. Consequently, <b8_0>the <b5_0>three<b5_0/> EI techniques carried over from ISO 12232:1998<b8_0/> are not widely used in recent camera models (<a1_0>approximately <b6_0>2007<b6_0/> and later<a1_0/>). As those earlier techniques did not allow for measurement from images produced with lossy compression, they cannot be used at all on <a2_0>cameras that produce images only in <b9_0>JPEG<b9_0/> format<a2_0/>.
